medical_history.chief_complaint: Persistent Müllerian duct syndrome (PMDS) in two brothers, characterized by bilateral nonpalpable testes.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms observed at a young age, with clinical recognition and subsequent laparoscopy at 7 years for the index case, S1, and laparotomy at 4 years for S2. Both brothers displayed normal external genitalia but had cryptorchidism and Müllerian derivatives.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The index case, S1, underwent laparoscopy at 7 years. S2 underwent laparotomy at 4 years, both indicating previous cryptorchidism and associated anatomical findings.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of PMDS with two affected brothers; the youngest sibling, S3, is clinically normal. Maternal transmission of mutations detected.
